contentrichtext.text: '''[[Sinbad the Sailor]]''' is a character from ''The Book of One Thousand and One Nights'', also known as ''Arabian Nights''. Sinbad or '''Sindbad''' may also refer to: * [[Sinbad (entertainer)]], the stage name of stand-up comedian and actor David Adkins ** ''[[The Sinbad Show]]'', his television sitcom ** ''Sinbad: It's Just Family'', his reality show on the [[WE tv]] network * [[Sinbad (USCG)]] (1937-1951), a dog who served in the United States Coast Guard * [[Sunpadh]] (Sinbad the Magian), an Iranian cleric who incited a revolt in the 8th century ;In entertainment *[[Sinbad (musical)|''Sinbad'' (musical)]]'', a 1918 Broadway musical *[[Sinbad (1891 musical)|''Sinbad'' (1891 musical)]], an 1891 musical *[[Sinbad (1992 film)|''Sinbad'' (1992 film)]], a 1992 motion picture *[[Sinbad (UK TV series)|''Sinbad'' (UK TV series)]], a 2012 television series *[[Sinbad the Sailor (film)|''Sinbad'' the Sailor (film)]], a 1947 film *''[[Sinbad Jr. and his Magic Belt]]'', an animated television series produced by Hanna-Barbera *''[[Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger]]'', a 1977 motion picture *''[[Sinbad of the Seven Seas]]'', a 1989 motion picture *''[[Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas]]'', a 2003 animated motion picture produced by DreamWorks SKG *Sindbad's Storybook Voyage, a ride in [[Tokyo DisneySea]] *''[[The Adventures of Sinbad]]'', a 1996 television series *''[[Arabian Nights: Sinbad's Adventures]]'', a 1975 animated series *''[[The Golden Voyage of Sinbad]]'', a 1974 motion picture *[[Sadko (film)|''Sadko'' (film)]], a 1952 Russian film later released in the United States in 1962 as ''The Magic Voyage of Sinbad'' *''[[The 7th Voyage of Sinbad]]'', a 1958 motion picture * [[Thomas 'Sinbad' Sweeney]], a character in the soap opera ''Brookside'' played by Michael Starke * Sinbad the Sailor, an alias of [[Edmond Dantès]] in the novel ''The Count of Monte Cristo'' *''[[Szindbád]]'', a 1971 Hungarian film directed by Zoltán Huszárik. ==See also== *[[MV Sinbad]] a ship captured by the Royal Navy during the Second World War * [[Simbad (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
